benchmark_details.name: CaselawQA
benchmark_details.overview: A benchmark comprising 260 legal annotation tasks, nearly all new to the machine learning community.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To facilitate empirical legal research through efficient legal annotation.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The fine-tuned models are still far from perfect, and the variance in accuracy across tasks remains high.

data.source: U.S. Supreme Court Database (SCDB) and U.S. Courts of Appeals Database (USCAD).
data.annotation: Labels created from existing court case data.

methodology.calculation: Weighted average of task accuracies across all task examples.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better model performance on legal annotation tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: Average accuracy of commercial models ranged from 70% to 78% on CaselawQA.
methodology.validation: Evaluated models against a train/validation/test split.
